title: RYX573
author: RYX573
content: Very simple - please do not make Bitcoin transfers. Bitcoins transfers will be faster, if users will not use Bitcoins. Network lags in this way will be resolved. Please use Bitcoin only in very rare cases - may be once a year.

comments.author: Bttzed03
comments.body: I don't think that's going to work. It's not just about the frequency of transaction. You have to understand about the average block confirmation time of 10 minutes (it could be faster or slower than that at times) and the mining difficulty adjustment which happens every 2016 blocks.If you happen to experience a fast confirmation time (under 10 minutes), you can expect that the mining difficulty will be increased in the next blocks. That means longer confirmation time.

comments.author: NotATether
comments.body: Quote from: RYX573 on June 25, 2022, 05:48:40 PMVery simple - please do not make Bitcoin transfers. Bitcoins transfers will be faster, if users will not use Bitcoins. Network lags in this way will be resolved. Please use Bitcoin only in very rare cases - may be once a year.Well you have to be honest, we are heading in that direction in due time. If only the LN channels and small proportions of internal services (perhaps exchanges and anything else which needs to move around funds) are the main transaction-broadcasters on the network, the mempool congestion problems would be largely solved.The thing is, this outcome is not expected to be reached for at least another decade.
